metric_abbrev_map._DESC_: these are the strings used as column headers in client data

en.HINT_E: Represents the number of evictions that have resulted in eviction judgment.
en.HINT_ER: Represents the number of eviction judgments per 100 renters.
en.HINT_EF: Represents the number of eviction filings.
en.HINT_EFR: Represents the number of eviction filings filed by the state per 100 renters.
en.SHARE_DESCRIPTION: Share a link to this map and data, or embed the map on your website
en.SHARE_LABEL_LINK: Share a link or embed on your website
en.REPORTS_DESCRIPTION: Download the current data and graphs in PowerPoint, PDF, or spreadsheet files
en.GETDATA_DESCRIPTION: Access spreadsheets of full data sets from across the U.S.
en.TOOLTIP_EFR: {{value}} evictions were filed for every 100 renter households.
en.TOOLTIP_TR: {{value}} of renter households have been threatened with eviction.
en.DATAMODE_DESCRIPTION: There are two datasets available for exploring eviction data. Choose one below:
en.DATAMODE_RAW_DESCRIPTION: An updated version of our original map. It displays values from proprietary data with limited national coverage for states, counties, cities, census tracts, and block groups. Data quality is indicated by X flags. Read our methodology to learn more about the proprietary data.
en.DATAMODE_MODELED_DESCRIPTION: Based on data collected from state courts. Uses a Bayesian model to address uncertainty and missing data. The resulting dataset has full national coverage for states and counties. Read our methodology to learn more about this process.
en.SELECT_BUBBLE_UNAVAILABLE: Some metrics are only available in the original dataset.  Click on the data mode button to switch between original and modeled data.
en.SELECT_REGION_UNAVAILABLE: Some regions are only available in the original or modeled dataset.  Click on the data mode button to switch between original and modeled data.
en.UNAVAILABLE_METRIC: This metric is not available in the selected dataset.
en.UNAVAILABLE_REGION: This region is not available in the selected dataset.
en.UNAVAILABLE_ZOOM: This region is not available at this zoom level, zoom in to see it.
en.FOOTER_NEWSLETTER: Sign up to receive news about events and new features from Eviction Lab.
en.FOOTER_COPYWRITE: All content Â© Eviction Lab. All rights reserved..
en.HINT_RB: The percentage of household income spent on rent. The maximum value is 50%, representing 50% or more.
en.HINT_PH: Represents the % of the population of Hispanic or Latino origin and any race according to the Census.
en.HINT_DEMOGRAPHICS: Population estimates of the area's overall population.
en.FLAG_INSUFFICIENT_1: A majority of cases lacked sufficient information to assess if they ended with an eviction judgment. Judgment figures for this county are unreliable.
en.FLAG_INSUFFICIENT_2: Many cases lacked sufficient information to assess if they ended with an eviction judgment. Interpret judgment figures from this county with caution.
en.FLAG_UNRELIABLE_1: We could not locate the address of a large portion of cases in this county. Sub-county estimates may be unreliable.
en.FLAG_UNRELIABLE_2: We could not locate the address of a very large portion of cases in this county. Sub-county estimates are very unreliable.
en.FLAG_UNVALIDATED_1: We could not validate the data in this county using external statistics. Use these figures with caution.
en.FLAG_UNVALIDATED_2: The displayed figure is likely an undercount of the true number of eviction cases in this area. See the FAQ for more information.
en.FLAG_OUTLIERS_1: This area has an eviction/filing rate in the top 1%. Please see our FAQ section to better understand why.
en.FLAG_OUTLIERS_17_18: Proprietary data for this year have not yet been externally validated. Please use with caution.
en.FLAG_MD: Because of the way Maryland records eviction notices, it has a much higher filing rate than everywhere else. Please see our FAQ section to better understand why.
en.FLAG_NOLA: New Orleans' estimated 2016 eviction rate is too low. Please see our FAQ page to understand why.
